passage: The March on Washington in 1963 attracted over 250,000 people who gathered together to advocate for the civil and economic rights of African Americans. The march's most famous moment was Martin Luther King Jr.'s ______ speech that inspired millions.
question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
explanation: D: 'I Have a Dream' is the correct answer because it is the accurate title of Martin Luther King Jr.'s famous speech during the March on Washington.
distractor_explanation: 'I Have Dreams'' is incorrect because this is not the accurate title of the speech and the apostrophe is unnecessary.
'I Have Dream,' is incorrect because the title is incomplete and the comma is unnecessary.
'I've a Dream' is incorrect because it is an informal contraction and not the accurate title of the speech.
